Ingredients: 

For the Dough: 

• 3 cups all-purpose flour 
• 1/3 cup granulated sugar 
• 1/2 teaspoon salt 
• 2 teaspoons active dry yeast 
• 1/2 cup warm milk 
• 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened 
• 1 egg 

For the Pineapple Topping: 

• 1/2 cup all-purpose flour 
• 1/2 cup granulated sugar 
• 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened 
• 1 egg 
• 1/2 teaspoon baking powder 
• 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract 
• A few drops of yellow food coloring (optional) 

Procedure: 

For the Dough: 

1. In a small bowl, combine the warm milk and active dry yeast. Let it sit for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes frothy. 
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt. 
3. Add the frothy yeast mixture, softened butter, and egg to the dry ingredients. 
4. Mix everything together to form a sticky dough. 
5. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5-7 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic. If it's too sticky, you can add a little more flour. 
6. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours or until it has doubled in size. 

For the Pineapple Topping: 

1. In a mixing bowl, combine all the topping ingredients, including flour, sugar, butter, egg, baking powder, vanilla extract, and yellow food coloring (if using). Mix until you have a smooth, thick paste. 

Assembling the Pineapple Buns: 

1. Once the dough has risen, punch it down to release any air bubbles. 
2. Divide the dough into 5 equal portions and shape them into balls. 
3. Roll each dough ball into a round bun. 
4. Place the buns on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 
5. Divide the pineapple topping into 5 equal portions and flatten each portion into a disc. 
6. Place a disc of topping on top of each bun, pressing it down gently to adhere. 

Baking the Pineapple Buns: 

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. Bake the buns in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until they turn golden brown and the topping is slightly crispy. 
3. Remove the buns from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack. 


Enjoy your homemade Pineapple Buns! They can be served as a sweet treat for breakfast or as a snack. .
